channel.title: new-year-thoughts on bananafish
channel.description: Recent content in new-year-thoughts on bananafish

item.description:
Twenty twenty-three will be the year I stop putting too much pressure on myself.

2023 is the year that I will do the things that I want to do in life.

Last year was a year of great change and paralysis. It was the year in which I finished my undergraduate degree(s) and the question of what I truly wanted to do in the future stared me straight in the face.

item.title: 2021 in Review // Hopes for 2022
item.description:
What better way to start off the new year than to review last year? - Sebastian Lau, actually 2022 (actually 2021)

Part 1: 2021 in Review ¶

Year of Stanisław Lem ¶

The year of 2021 is declared the Year of Stanisław Lem in Poland, according to the November 27, 2020 resolution of Sejm (the lower house of the parliament of Poland). […] 2021 is the year of the 100th Stanisław Lem anniversary.- Wikipedia

item.title: A New Year 2021
item.description:
Jan 17, 2021 ¶

Blah, blah, blah, 2020 was a terrible year. Done.

In the never-ending spirit tradition of setting a new year’s resolution that we don’t keep to, I thought I’d set a resolution given that we’re still in the opening days of the new year, i.e. it’s still January. I’ve still got time to start…

I promise to write at least one post per fortnight, or at the bare minimum, once a month.
